result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Charles Taylor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Charles Taylor appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by video for Mark Charles Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case may resolve with an informal resolution.  Case is adjourned to 12-5-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Charles Taylor in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 10-10-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Charles Taylor in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties inform the Court the case may resolve with a tier 1 resolution.  Parties are requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 8-18-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Charles Taylor in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark Charles Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD:  Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KST.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mark Charles Taylor in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Due to the intake judge of the week, Defendant is advised this case is re-tabbed to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
